actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Government Operations.

official_title: A bill to abolish certain Federal agencies, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Federal Agency Efficiency Act - Abolishes the Interstate Commerce Commission, the Selective Service System, the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, the Small Business Administration, the Renegotiation Board, the Presidents' Council on Physical Fitness and Sports and all offices of the Department of Defense relating to civil defense except for: (1) the functions of the Secretary of Defense relating to alerting the public against an enemy attack, and (2) the functions of any Federal agency relating to a warning system for impending natural disaster, as determined pursuant to regulations of the Office of Management and Budget. Specifies that nothing in this or any Act shall be constructed as authorizing the Central Intelligence Agency to: (1) carry out directly or indirectly, within the United States, any police or police-type operation, any law enforcement operation, or any internal security operation; or (2) provide assistance to any other department or agency of the Federal Government, of any State or local government, or to any officer or employee of any such instrumentality engaged in police or police-type operations, law enforcement operations, or internal security operations, within the United States unless such assistance is provided with the prior, specific written approval of the Central Intelligence Agency oversight subcommittees of the Committees on Appropriations and the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives. Stipulates that the President may not reestablish any office or agency abolished by this Act. Transfers the disaster loan functions of the Small Business Administration to the Secretary of Commerce.

titles.title: A bill to abolish certain Federal agencies, and for other purposes.
